thread.title: Charter Communications makes list of 'most hated' companies
thread.title_full: Charter Communications makes list of 'most hated' companies

author: Joe Holleman St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Charter Communications makes list of 'most hated' companies

organizations.name: time warner cable and bright house

text:
Get your daily dose of local news right here. Close The Associated Press 
This April 1, 2015 photo shows signage at an entrance to Charter Communications' offices in Town and Country. Charter seeks to create a cable giant through its proposed $67.1 billion acquisition of Time Warner Cable and Bright House. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) Charter Communications makes list of 'most hated' companies ( … ) The Associated Press 
This April 1, 2015 photo shows signage at an entrance to Charter Communications' offices in Town and Country. Charter seeks to create a cable giant through its proposed $67.1 billion acquisition of Time Warner Cable and Bright House. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) 
Since spending $71 billion in May to buy Time Warner Cable and another company, Charter Communications has begun rebranding itself as "Spectrum." 
But even a catchy new moniker could not keep the nation's second-largest cable/internet provider company off the spectrum of the disliked. 
In its thumbnail synopsis, the 24/7 reporters noted : 
"Charter has one of the poorest reputations for customer service of any company in the subscription television service industry. It also scores below average in customer service compared to its competitors in the fixed line telephone industry and internet service industry." 
That's not good news, considering that subscription television service, fixed-line telephones and internet service are pretty much the three things the company does for a living. 
If there is good news for Charter within this list, it may be that the No. 1 most-hated company was Comcast, also a provider of subscription television and internet services. 
Founded in 1993, Charter moved its headquarters in 2012 from St. Louis to Stamford, Conn., but it maintains a corporate office and call center in Town and Country. 
Joe Holleman • 314-340-8254
